summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons Health Services clinical encounter form documenting a medical assessment of an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on August 9, 2019. The assessment was requested by an LT and finds no acute injuries, noting the inmate is being placed in a dry cell and is being treated for constipation.

events.title: Medical Assessment and Placement in Dry Cell
events.description: An inmate at MCC New York undergoes a medical assessment requested by an LT. The assessment finds no acute injuries, notes old healing injuries, and the inmate is being placed in a dry cell. The inmate is also treated for constipation.

locations: MCC New York, 150 Park Row, New York NY 10007
keyFacts: The medical assessment was performed on August 9, 2019, at 3:01 PM at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The assessment was requested by an LT (a U.S. Public Health Service Physician Assistant) and finds 'no injuries' and 'neg objective findings' for acute trauma.
The document states the inmate 'is being placed on Dry cell,' indicating a change in confinement conditions.
The assessment notes 'old healing ecchymosis on the right periorbital area noted from zygomatic fx,' indicating a prior facial fracture.
The inmate was diagnosed with constipation and prescribed Docusate Sodium, with the plan including a follow-up as needed.
